result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Finley

9:51 AM Defendant Christopher M. Finley in court, in custody.
Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Christopher M. Finley.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter:  Tracy Czarnecki-Kozmer.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CF760, 22CF435, 22CF1207:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time,
def. trying to get in to the Drug Court.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Minutes:  22CF1207/21CF760/22CF435.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Eric Olson.  Defense requests an adjournment; attempting to get the deft into Drug Treatment Court.  No objection by the State.  Status set for 11/1/22 @ 9:45am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
 ****EFFECTIVE 7/19/22****
 *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  *Not To Discuss Case w/Theresa W.

01:52 PM
Defendant Christopher M. Finley appeared by phone means and in-custody.
Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Defendant Christopher M. Finley.
Prosecuting Atty Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CF760 & 22CF435:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment of the plea hrg, def. is enrolled in the Vivitrol Program.
Parties stipulate to the cash bond in 22CF435 being amended to a sign. bond.
Court amends the cash bond to a $2,500 sign. bond w/same conds in case 22CF435, effective 7/19/2022.
Matter set over for status hrg, bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:50 AM Defendant Christopher M. Finley appeared by phone means and in-custody.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Defendant Christopher M. Finley.

MINUTES:
21CF760 & 22CF435:

Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

= Defendant Christopher M. Finley appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  *Not To Discuss Case w/Theresa W.

02:06 PM 
  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 4/13/22 @ 930am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
